title: Iraq crisis: Mosul dam 'retaken' by Iraqi and Kurdish forces | World news | The Guardian
summary: cameron to manage iraq crisis via blackberry .
cameron : 'uk not getting involved in another iraq war '
us video footage of air strikes around mosul dam .
mosul dam retaken , state tv claims .

text: we are going to pause the blog for now .
here 's a summary of the latest developments : iraqi and kurdish officials say they have retaken control of the mosul dam , but the extent of that control is unclear .
several reporters in the area described continued clashes throughout the day and said that it was too early to declare that the battle was over .
islamic special forces were photographed at the gates of the dam .
david cameron has insisted that britain 's mission in iraq will not creep into another war , but conceded that the operation had moved beyond providing humanitarian aid .
in the face of criticism about the operation he said the government has a fully worked through '' strategy to tackle islamic state extremists .
the prime minister also repeated his refusal to recall parliament to discuss the crisis in iraq .
and he defended his decision to take another family holiday saying he could managed the iraq crisis via mobile phone .
the us has conducted its most concerted bombing campaign yet over northern iraq to drive isis forces back in a bid to help kurdish and iraqi forces try to retake the mosul dam .
american warplanes and drones carried out more than 20 strikes at the weekend near the crucial dam that isis forces took earlier this month .
further us strikes were reported on monday .
barack obama has written to congress to state that he authorised us air strikes to help retake the dam , and that the action was consistent with his goal of protecting us citizens .

the letter said : the failure of the mosul dam could threaten the lives of large numbers of civilians , endanger us personnel and facilities , including the u.s. embassy in baghdad , and prevent the iraqi government from providing critical services to the iraqi populace i have directed these actions , which are in the national security and foreign policy interests of the united states . ''
analysts pointed out that the protection of key infrastructure represented an expansion on the stated aims of the mission .
german foreign minister frank-walter steinmeir has warned against the formation of an independent kurdish state , as he travelled to kurdistan for talks with its president masoud barzani .
an independent kurdish state would create new tensions , possibly also with the states neighbouring iraq , '' steinmeir said .
saudia arabia has strenuously denied supporting or funding islamic state militants .
in a letter to the guardian its ambassador to britain wrote : the government of saudi arabia does not support or fund the murderers who have collected under the banner of the islamic state .
their ideology is not one that we recognise , or that would be recognised by the vast majority of muslims around the world - whether they were sunni or shia . ''

the letter came as saudi arabia and kuwait agreed to comply with a un resolution aimed at stopping financing for islamist militant groups in syria and iraq after four of their nationals were named among a group blacklisted by the international body .
producer kate benyon-tinker confirms the continuing volatility around the mosul dam .

kate benyon-tinker ( @ katebt3000 ) filming at peshmerga position near mosul dam just before leaving in a hurry due to incoming is fire # iraq there have been consistent reports of isis forces fighting back even if kurdish and iraqi forces generally appear to be in the ascendency in the area .
carol malouf ( @ carolmalouf ) # peshmerga forces at badrieh checkpoint heading in to the # arab towns around # mosuldam after # isis retreated
competing images , match the completing claims about who controls the mosul dam .
kurdish and iraqi officials claim the dam has been retaken , amid reports of continued fighting in the area .
the official 's claim has been supported by an image of iraqi special forces at the gates of the dam .

sajad jiyad سجاد ( @ sajadjiyad ) golden division of isf special forces , at the mosul dam today islamic state supporters have been retweeting an image of a fighter flying its black flag from the dam .
iiraqtoday ( @ iiraqtoday ) سد الموصل اصبح بيد الدوله الاسلاميه # رد للقنوات الإخبارية العبريه الكاذبة the timing of both is impossible to verify .
fewer than a quarter of britons think the uk should offer asylum to christians fleeing iraq , according to a poll by itv news .
the polls comes amid fresh calls for britain to do more for christian refugees .
canon andrew white , the vicar of the only anglican church in baghdad , said granting asylum would give hope to iraqi christians .
speaking on the bbc 's today programme he said it 's a matter of life and death we need our people to be given asylum . ''

documents.title: cameron to manage iraq crisis via blackberry
text: david cameron has insisted he will still be able to manage '' britain 's response to iraq crisis via his blackberry , as he headed off for another family holiday , pa reports .
the prime minister is expected to take his family to cornwall for a break this week , after returning from portugal last week .
asked whether it was right that he was going away amid efforts to tackle the threat from islamic state extremists , the premier said he would remain within a few feet of a blackberry '' .
pa quoted him saying : i always make sure there are senior ministers on duty in westminster .
but i do n't hand over the government to a deputy .
wherever i am , wherever i am in the world i am always within a few feet of a blackberry and an ability to manage things should they need to be managed .
and indeed as i have done on i think almost every holiday that i have enjoyed over the last few years , to return instantly should that be necessary .
for the next few days i shall not be terribly far away , so if that 's necessary you will find me at my desk .
david cameron reading from his blackberry during a school visit in 2011 .
hartley/rex
nbc 's bill neely , reports continued fighting around the mosul dam where he says isis has taken a pounding '' but still fights back .
in a series of tweets he said isis militants were in retreat after new us air strikes , but peshmerga fighters did not appear to be in full control of the dam .
bill neely ( @ billneelynbc ) kurdish fighters claim they have taken mosul dam & the whole area .

it did n't look like it- still fighting as isis retreats from the dam writing on the network he added : i 'm in the mosul dam area where there is still fierce fighting between isisand kurdish forces .
us airstrikes continue in the area .
smoke billows from three positions around the dam itself .
a village 10 miles from it , is shrouded in smoke .
[ there are ] new explosions every few minutes .
we watched kurdish fighters fire rockets at isis targets six miles from them .
but much closer was a noisy ground battle-machine guns blazing .
after kurdish fighters fired four rockets , isis fired back three shells landing 80 yards from where we were .
isis .
targeted firing point in minutes us warplanes [ were ] overhead during most of this battle .
it 's clearly taking place across a front of at least 30 miles .
isis [ is ] clearly being pushed i saw many isis vehicles destroyed .
one with the black isis emblem on [ the ] side .
another in pieces ; clearly hit by airstrike .
an isis checkpoint had been hit from the air- a building flattened , a vehicle destroyed .
isis have taken a pounding in the dam area after isis fired artillery shells at the kurdish position we were in , we moved back .
isis had clearly identified exactly where we were .
the telegraph 's ruth sherlock confirms that the fight for the dam is far from over '' .
ruth sherlock ( @ rsherlock ) fight at # mosul dam far from over - some # peshmerga apparently at dam , but area booby trapped .
also some mortar fire from # isis cells # iraq
iraqi forces are planning an assault on the northern city of mosul , hoping to retake it from islamic state fighters , the spokesman for the country 's counter-terrorism unit told reuters .

the new tactic of launching a quick attack shrouded by secrecy proved successful and we are determined to keep following the new assault tactics with help of intelligence provided by americans , '' spokesman sabah nouri told reuters .
the next stop will be mosul . ''
david cameron has repeated his refusal to recall parliament to discuss the crisis in iraq , nicholas watt reports .

nicholas watt ( @ nicholaswatt ) pm : not necessary to recall parliament over iraq but happy to keep it under review meanwhile , the foreign secretary philip hammond has been chairing another meeting of the government 's emergency committee , according to reports from the lobby .
laura kuenssberg ( @ bbclaurak ) hammond chairing cobra on iraq right now
afp also reports that the mosul dam has fallen , citing kurdish and iraqi officials .

fighting on monday erupted in an area south of the mosul dam while engineering teams worked to clear booby traps and bombs left by jihadists , said kawa khatari , an official from iraq 's main kurdish party .

iraqi security spokesman lieutenant general qassem atta confirmed on monday that mosul dam was entirely liberated in a joint operation by iraqi anti-terrorism forces and peshmerga forces with aerial support '' .
atta added on state television that while the dam had been retaken , fighting was continuing in adjoining facilities including a residential compound .

the mosul dam breakthrough came after us warplanes and drones at the weekend carried out their heaviest-yet bombing against is militants in the north since they began launching air strikes on 8 august .

the us central command reported that the military had carried out 14 air strikes sunday near the dam located on the tigris river , which provides electricity and irrigation water for farming to much of the region .
sunday 's strikes destroyed 10 is armed vehicles , seven is humvees , two armoured personnel carriers and one is checkpoint .
another reporter in the area disputes the claim that the dam has fallen .
elijah magnier from the italian broadcaster rai , tweets : elijah j magnier ( @ ejmalrai ) attack on the east but the dam itself it is fully under is still .
more peshmerga are very close coming toward it @ twitterid4life @ twitterid
here 's a summary of the latest developments : state tv and iraqi officials have claimed that the mosul dam has been retaken from islamic state militants by peshmerga fighters and the iraqi army .
but reporters close to the facility say that fighting has continued amid counter claims from the militants that they still control the dam .
david cameron has insisted that britain 's mission in iraq will not creep into another war , but conceded that the operation had moved beyond providing humanitarian aid .
in the face of criticism about the operation he said the government has a fully worked through '' strategy to tackle islamic state extremists .
the us has conducted its most concerted bombing campaign yet over northern iraq to drive isis forces back in a bid to help kurdish and iraqi forces try to retake the mosul dam .
american warplanes and drones carried out more than 20 strikes at the weekend near the crucial dam that isis forces took earlier this month .
barack obama has written to congress to state that he authorised us air strikes to help retake the dam , and that the action was consistent with his goal of protecting us citizens .

the letter said : the failure of the mosul dam could threaten the lives of large numbers of civilians , endanger us personnel and facilities , including the u.s. embassy in baghdad , and prevent the iraqi government from providing critical services to the iraqi populace i have directed these actions , which are in the national security and foreign policy interests of the united states . ''
analysts pointed out that the protection of key infrastructure represented an expansion on the stated aims of the mission .
german foreign minister frank-walter steinmeir has warned against the formation of an independent kurdish state , as he travelled to kurdistan for talks with its president masoud barzani .
an independent kurdish state would create new tensions , possibly also with the states neighbouring iraq , '' steinmeir said .
saudia arabia has strenuously denied supporting or funding islamic state militants .
in a letter to the guardian its ambassador to britain wrote : the government of saudi arabia does not support or fund the murderers who have collected under the banner of the islamic state .
their ideology is not one that we recognise , or that would be recognised by the vast majority of muslims around the world - whether they were sunni or shia . ''

the letter came as saudi arabia and kuwait agreed to comply with a un resolution aimed at stopping financing for islamist militant groups in syria and iraq after four of their nationals were named among a group blacklisted by the international body .
there continue to be conflicting reports and claims about who now controls the mosul dam .
here 's a map showing the dam 's position north of mosul .
map showing the mosul dam if breached it would unleash catastrophic flooding across a vast swath of territory as far south as baghdad , according to the washington post .
but kurdish and us officials said fears that the militants would blow it up have been overstated .
among other things , it would be difficult to assemble enough explosives to do so .
moreover , said brig .

gen. azad hawezi , a senior kurdish commander , they would flood themselves first , because the first place that would disappear would be mosul , '' the biggest city controlled by the islamic state immediately south of the dam .

army spokesman lieutenant general qassim al-moussawi told associated press that peshmerga forces and iraqi anti-terrorism troops fully liberated '' the dam on monday and hoisted the iraqi flag over it . ''
al-mousawi added that the troops were backed by a joint aerial support , but he did n't specify whether there were any u.s. airstrikes in the area of the dam on monday .
local residents and others in the area could not immediately be contacted to confirm the security forces ' recapture of the dam , ap points out .

documents.title: us video footage of air strikes around mosul dam
text: the us military has released video footage of air strikes against islamic state militants near the mosul dam , amid reports of continuing air strikes today .
one clip from saturday , shows a us air strike against isis forces in a us made humvee .
another filmed on the same day shows an attack on an armed up truck .
another western journalist near the mosul dam , cnn 's anna coren , has confirmed that there is still a battle for the control of facility .
anna coren ( @ amcoren ) near # mosul dam where fighting is still raging - peshmerga forces hoping to seize the facility .
snipers and iandmines slowing down advance
german foreign minister frank-walter steinmeir has warned against the formation of an independent kurdish state , as he travelled to kurdistan for talks with its president masoud barzani .
an independent kurdish state would create new tensions , possibly also with the states neighbouring iraq , '' steinmeir said in an interview with germany 's bild am sonntag newspaper .
germanforeignoffice ( @ germanydiplo ) # steinmeier w/ kurdistan reg .
pres .
@ twitterid barzani in # erbil : must not leave # iraq alone in this difficult situation
itv 's john ray , who is close to the mosul dam , says the battle for control of the facility is not over .

john ray ( @ johnrayitv ) after two days of heavy striking here , the battle is still not over - islamic state fighters still control part of the dam # iraq in his most recent tweet he reports seeing convoys of peshmerga fighters heading for the front line .

john ray ( @ johnrayitv ) i am at mosul dam watching 20 convoys packed with kurdish peshmerga fighters head to the frontline # iraq the telegraph 's ruth sherlock reports new us air strikes in the area .
ruth sherlock ( @ rsherlock ) # us been doing airstrikes since 6am towards # mosul dam .
but # peshmerga not taken it yet , as # isis booby trapped area .
# iraq # kurds # is
state tv 's claim that the mosul dam is under government and kurdish control , is still unconfirmed , reuters points out .
the television station quoted lieutenant-general qasim atta , a military spokesman , as saying the forces were backed by a joint air patrol .
he did not give details .
an independent verification was not immediately possible .
a twitter account belonging to a media organisation that supports the islamic state said the dam was still under the group 's full control .

on sunday , a mosul dam engineer who has been in close contact with islamic state militants holding the dam said they had been placing roadside bombs along roads leading in and out of the complex in anticipation of an assault .
confusion about control of the dam threaten a repeat of the conflicting reports about control of iraq 's biggest oil refinery at baiji .
the refinery was the scene of heavy fighting in june and july and the source of competing claims about who was in control .
the iraqi army did retake the refinery in july , but it has since come under renewed attack by islamic militants .
iraqi kurdish peshmerga fighters celebrate retaking the mosul dam on the tigris river .
al-rubaye/afp/getty images

documents.title: mosul dam retaken , state tv claims
text: iraqi and kurdish forces have now retaken control of the mosul dam , according to state tv .
the associated press ( @ ap ) breaking : iraq state tv says iraqi forces , kurdish troops have retaken strategic mosul dam from islamic militants .
al jazeera has frontline footage of the kurdish operation to retake the mosul dam .
it confirmed that the peshmerga have three towns close to the dam , and its commanders were confidant of rataking the facility , but it was too early for them to declare victory .

documents.title: cameron : 'uk not getting involved in another iraq war '
text: david cameron has insisted that britain 's mission in iraq will not creep into another war , but conceded that the operation had moved beyond providing humanitarian aid .
in the face of criticism about the operation he said the government has a fully worked through '' strategy to tackle islamic state extremists , pa reports .
the prime minister argued that limited action was needed to prevent violence spreading to british streets .

labour and senior church of england bishops have complained that the government has no coherent or comprehensive approach '' to islamist extremism and is failing to protect christians from persecution .
speaking on bbc breakfast this morning , cameron said : what we are trying to do is to help with the situation that we face .

first of all , that is the humanitarian situation that we face but alongside the humanitarian crisis there is also a political and extremism crisis in iraq that has a direct effect on us back here in the uk .
we do want to have , and we do have , a fully worked through strategy for helping allies to deal with this monstrous organisation , is .

so we are helping the kurds , we are working with the iraqi government to make sure it is more representative of the whole country and , of course , we are working with neighbours and allies to put the maximum amount of pressure on is and make sure it is properly dealt with .
we have said that if the kurds , the peshmerga , want to have arms from us , that is something we would consider favourably .
up to now they have not been making that request .
really the sort of weapons they have been using have been more eastern bloc variety , and so they have been supplied by others .
cameron said he viewed the kurds as the first line of defence against these murderous extremists in is that are causing so much damage in iraq '' .
but he insisted that is had already started inflicting damage here in europe '' , highlighting a shooting at a jewish museum in brussels .
we have already had the first is motivated attacks in europe ; for instance , the dreadful terrorism that took place in brussels just a few weeks ago .
i want to be absolutely clear to you and to families watching at home , britain is not going to get involved in another war in iraq .
we are not going to be putting boots on the ground .
we are not going to be sending in the british army .

yes , we should use all the assets that we have , our diplomacy , our political relationships , our aid , the military prowess , the expertise that we have to help others - we should use these things as part of a strategy to put pressure on islamic state and make sure this terrorist organisation is properly addressed and it can not cause mayhem on our own streets .

prime minister david cameron who has said that the advance of islamic state extremists poses a clear danger '' to the future safety of britain 's streets as he explained his decision to arm kurdish fighters .
furlong/pa
rory stewart , a former diplomat and current tory chairman of the commons defence committee , says the international community is right to be hesitant about further involvement in iraq .
speaking from irbil on a fact-finding tour of iraq , stewart said the current advance of isis militant was similar to a previous sunni insurgency which 120,000 us troops were powerless to prevent .

stewart , who served as an coalitin official in occupied iraq , said : said : from 2007 we had a situation in which the americans were spending $ 120bn a year , they had 120,000 troops on the ground , trying to deal with a very similar insurgency .
it has now come back again , four and half years later , in an even worse form .

the reason you have to pause , is that you have to think , if david petraeus with 120,000 troops and $ 120bn a year of expenditure , was n't able to bring a lasting peace to those areas , what exactly are you proposing to do now ? ''
in an interview with bbc radio 4 's today programme , he added : we need far far more information .
the lesson above all of our last intervention in iraq is that we have got to focus on what we can do . ''
stewart backed moves to arm kurish forces .
but he said kurdish forces needed reforms to become united and more professional .
providing weapons only makes sense if it comes along with substantial reforms to the way that the kurds operate , '' the mp said .
its unclear whether kurdish forces are in full control of the mosul dam or just part of it .
mosul dam was liberated completely , '' ali awni , an official from iraq 's main kurdish party , told afp , said on sunday in a statement confirmed by two other kurdish sources .
but kurdish officials rowed back on the claim by monday .
an official told reuters that the dam had not been retaken but most of the surrounding area '' had been seized .
a kurdish peshmerga fighter prepares his weapon at his combat position near the mosul dam at the town of chamibarakat outside mosul , iraq .
kurdish forces took over parts of the largest dam in iraq on sunday less than two weeks after it was captured by the islamic state .
mohammed/ap
rupert murdoch 's british papers continue to sound the drumbeat for increased military intervention in iraq .
a sun editorial backs military strikes in iraq and criticises the labour leader ed miliband in the same sentence .

it says : with is [ islamic state ] now in charge of much of syria and iraq , our shambolic response to the syria last year - when ed miliband kyboshed david cameron 's plans to intervene - ought to serve as a frightening warning of what happens when we stand back .
this is a fight we have to have .
and to win .
matthew weaver ( @ matthew weaver ) sun beats the drum for more military intervention in iraq in its editorial the times attacks the hesitancy of barack obama on iraq .
the obama administration has been culpably hesitant .

since islamists captured mosul in june , american policy has been caught between pressuring iraq 's government to become more inclusive ( withholding military support as a means to this end ) and directly striking at the islamic state .
progress has been made on the first aim but too much time has been lost on the second .
airstrikes alone can not defeat the forces of jihadism in iraq and syria .
humanitarian and military aid for iraq 's government and for kurdish forces is essential too .
mission creep ?

the aims of the us campaign in iraq have expanded to included protecting critical infrastructure , such as the mosul dam , washington 's institute for the study of war points out in its latest situation report on the conflict .
it said the added aim could be used to jusify a wider us role in countering isis that extends beyond protecting irbil and the yazidi refugees around sinjar '' .
isw ( @ thestudyofwar ) our iraq situation report for the day has been updated !
read more about it here : the revised aims of the mission are set out in obama 's letter to congress .
welcome to our live coverage of the continuing crisis in iraq .

here 's a summary of the latest developments : britain is stepping up its military involvement in the fight against the islamic state in iraq after the defence secretary confirmed that british warplanes are flying deeper into iraq in a mission that could last months '' .

this is not simply a humanitarian mission , '' michael fallon said as it was confirmed that raf tornado jets , which were deployed to the region last week to identify the location of yazidi refugees , are now monitoring islamic state ( isis ) positions .
the us has conducted its most concerted bombing campaign yet over northern iraq to drive isis forces back , helping kurdish forces to reclaim the mosul dam .
american warplanes and drones carried out more than 20 strikes at the weekend near the crucial dam that isis forces took earlier this month .
barack obama has written to congress to state that he authorised us air strikes to help retake the dam , and that the action was consistent with his goal of protecting us citizens .

the letter said : the failure of the mosul dam could threaten the lives of large numbers of civilians , endanger us personnel and facilities , including the u.s. embassy in baghdad , and prevent the iraqi government from providing critical services to the iraqi populace i have directed these actions , which are in the national security and foreign policy interests of the united states . ''
david cameron declared that britain should be prepared to deploy its military prowess '' to help defeat the jihadis .

writing in the sunday telegraph , the prime minister said a firm security response '' is needed to defeat the jihadist militants , who have created an expanding caliphate in the heart of iraq and parts of syria .
saudia arabia has strenuously denied supporting or funding islamic state militants .
in a letter to the guardian its ambassador to britain wrote : the government of saudi arabia does not support or fund the murderers who have collected under the banner of the islamic state .
their ideology is not one that we recognise , or that would be recognised by the vast majority of muslims around the world - whether they were sunni or shia . ''

the letter came as saudi arabia and kuwait agreed to comply with a un resolution aimed at stopping financing for islamist militant groups in syria and iraq after four of their nationals were named among a group blacklisted by the international body .

the church of england has delivered a withering critique of cameron 's middle east policy , describing the government 's approach as incoherent , ill-thought-out and determined by the loudest media voice at any particular time '' .

the criticisms are made in an extraordinary letter to the prime minister signed by the bishop of leeds , nicholas baines , and written with the support of the archbishop of canterbury , justin welby .

Cameron to manage Iraq crisis via Blackberry

Cameron: 'UK not getting involved in another Iraq war'

9.45am BST
09:45
Mosul dam retaken, state TV claims

bulletin.text: Cameron: 'UK is not getting involved in another Iraq war'
Defence secretary: 'not simply a humanitarian mission'
Iraqi and Kurdish forces claim to have retaken Mosul dam.
Reports say fight for dam continues after new US air strikes.
Saudi Arabia denies funding Islamic State militants.
